title: Slow Cooker Cowboy Casserole
description: This slow cooker cowboy casserole is a family-friendly, budget-friendly layered casserole of ground beef, sliced potatoes, and Cheddar cheese. It's easy to put together and let the slow cooker do the rest.
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook lean ground beef and onion over medium heat until beef is browned and onion is soft and translucent, 6 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir soup and milk together in a bowl.

Line a slow cooker with a slow cooker bag. Place a layer of potatoes, overlapping as needed, at the bottom of slow cooker. Season with salt and pepper. Top with a layer of ground beef, a layer of soup mixture and 1 cup cheese. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients.
Cook on High until potatoes are fork tender, 3 to 4 hours.
tips: Make sure to layer the ingredients as instructed for the best result. The slow cooker does the rest of the work for you!

structured_content.content: This slow cooker cowboy casserole is a family-friendly, budget-friendly layered casserole of ground beef, sliced potatoes, and Cheddar cheese.
It's easy to put together and let the slow cooker do the rest.

• Lean ground beef: Provides protein and flavor
  • Sliced potatoes: Gives the casserole body and substance

Step 1:
Cook beef and onions, add garlic and season
Step 2:
Stir soup and milk together
Step 3:
Layer ingredients in slow cooker
Step 4:
Cook until potatoes are tender

note.label: Things to Keep in Mind
note.content:
• Layer ingredients as instructed
  • Let the slow cooker do the work

structured_content.content: Add some hot sauce or chili flakes for a kick.
Serve with a side of green salad for a balanced meal.
Try using sweet potatoes for a different flavor profile.

note.label: Chef's Suggestions
note.content:
• Use a slow cooker bag for easy cleanup
  • Try different types of cheese for a new flavor
